sphinxtest package¶

Submodules¶

sphinxtest.sphinxtest module¶

class sphinxtest.sphinxtest.MyAddClass(x, y=0)¶

Bases: object

A class developed to test sphinx documentation builder. It stores two numbers and has a method to return their sum.

Parameters:
  • x – First input parameter, created to simulate how well documentation parser handles new lines.
  • y – Another parameter, this time without new lines.
Result:

An object of class MyAddClass.
Example: 
>>> x_input, y_input = 1, 2
>>> test_class = MyTestClass(x=x_input, 
...                          y=y_input)
>>> test_class
<test_class.MyAddClass at 0x24c6027ff98>
add()¶

Adds self.x and self.y and returns their sum. Also checks for them being numeric and throws ``TypeError``s when inputs are messed up.

Result:An number that is self.x + self.y.
Raises:TypeError if self.x or self.y is not numeric. Should really be implemented through @properties.
Example: 
>>> instance = MyTestClass(x=1, y=2)
>>> instance
3
